attributes.action: Prescription exemption - Parkinson's disease patients & other chronic illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: Parkinson's disease is a chronic neurological condition and which doesn't have a cure yet. Medications are the life line for Parkinson's patient. The medications helps them to control the symptoms and to help to attain the day to day activities which will enable them to lead a normal life with independence as much as they can.The Parkinson's medications should not be omitted at any cost as it can cause serious health impact on patients and at times which may not be reversible.
attributes.background: Curent prescription charge is £9.35. Placing Parkinson's disease in prescription exemptions list will help patients those who are on multiple medications.  Chronic illnesses like multiple sclerosis, irritable bowel syndrome, arthritis,COPD etc  also consider for free prescriptions.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Extend eligibility for free prescriptions to sufferers of Parkinson's disease: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/589911

Free prescriptions for endometriosis, fibromyalgia, PCOS & chronic pain syndrome: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599345

We could accept a petition calling for free prescriptions for everyone who suffers from a chronic condition, but it would need to be clear from the title and text of your petition that this is what you want.
